Define Documentation

#define cvm_common_alloc_fpa_buffer (  scratch_ptr,
pool   )     _alloc_fpa_buffer(__FILE__, __LINE__, scratch_ptr, pool)
 

Macro to allocate an FPA buffer asynchronously.

Parameters:
scratch_ptr - Scratch pad register address
pool - FPA pool from which the buffer should be allocated
This macro is a wraper around the cvmx_fpa_alloc() executive function. It tries to read an already allocated FPA buffer address from the scratch pad register. Once that is done, another buffer allocation request is initiated to work in the background and results are stored in the same scratch pad register. This register value is used for the next allocation.

#define cvm_common_alloc_fpa_buffer_sync (  pool   )     _alloc_fpa_buffer_sync(__FILE__, __LINE__, pool)
 

Macro to allocate an FPA buffer.

Parameters:
pool - FPA pool from which the buffer should be allocated
This macro is a wraper around the cvmx_fpa_alloc() executive function.

#define CVM_COMMON_CHECK_FPA_POOL (  pool,
ptr   ) 
 

Value:

({ \
    char correct_pool = 0; \
    cvm_common_fpa_info_t pool_info = cvm_common_fpa_info[pool]; \
    int i=0; \
    for (i=0; i<pool_info.count; i++) \
    { \
      if (( (uint64_t)(CAST64(cvmx_phys_to_ptr(CAST64(ptr)))) >= pool_info.entry[i].start_addr) && ( (uint64_t)(CAST64(cvmx_phys_to_ptr(CAST64(ptr)))) <= pool_info.entry[i].end_addr)) \
        { \
            correct_pool = 1; \
            break; \
        } \
    } \
    correct_pool; \
})
Checks whether the address belongs to correct FPA pool or not.

Parameters:
pool - FPA pool number
ptr - address to verify
This macro checks that the address 'ptr' belongs to the 'pool' or not.

#define cvm_common_discard_swp (  swp   )     _discard_swp(__FILE__, __LINE__, swp)
 

Macro to free both the linked/gather buffer pointed to by the packet_ptr field of work queue entry as well as the work queue entry itself.

Parameters:
swp - pointer to work queue entry
This macro frees linked or gather list pointed to by the packet_ptr field of work queue entry as well as the work qneue entry

#define CVM_COMMON_FPA_AVAIL_COUNT (  pool   )     cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_FPA_QUEX_AVAILABLE(pool))
 

#define CVM_COMMON_FPA_USE_COUNT_ADD (  pool,
val   ) 
 

Value:

{ \
    switch(pool) \
    { \
        case 0:  \
            cvmx_fau_atomic_add32(CVM_FAU_REG_POOL_0_USE_COUNT, val); \
            break; \
        case 1:  \
            cvmx_fau_atomic_add32(CVM_FAU_REG_POOL_1_USE_COUNT, val); \
            break; \
        case 2:  \
            cvmx_fau_atomic_add32(CVM_FAU_REG_POOL_2_USE_COUNT, val); \
            break; \
        case 3:  \
            cvmx_fau_atomic_add32(CVM_FAU_REG_POOL_3_USE_COUNT, val); \
            break; \
        case 4:  \
            cvmx_fau_atomic_add32(CVM_FAU_REG_POOL_4_USE_COUNT, val); \
            break; \
        case 5:  \
            cvmx_fau_atomic_add32(CVM_FAU_REG_POOL_5_USE_COUNT, val); \
            break; \
        case 6:  \
            cvmx_fau_atomic_add32(CVM_FAU_REG_POOL_6_USE_COUNT, val); \
            break; \
        case 7:  \
            cvmx_fau_atomic_add32(CVM_FAU_REG_POOL_7_USE_COUNT, val); \
            break; \
    } \
}

#define cvm_common_free_fpa_buffer (  ptr,
pool,
num_cache_lines   )     _free_fpa_buffer(__FILE__, __LINE__, ptr, pool, num_cache_lines)
 

Macro to free an allocated FPA buffer.

Parameters:
ptr - FPA address to be freed
pool - FPA pool to which the buffer should be freed - number of cache lines to be invalidated
This macro is a wraper around the cvmx_fpa_free() executive function.

#define CVM_COMMON_GET_FPA_USE_COUNT (  pool   ) 
 

#define CVM_COMMON_INC_OOB_COUNT (  pool   ) 
 

Value:

{ \
    int offset = pool*4 + CVM_FAU_REG_FPA_OOB_COUNT; \
    cvmx_fau_atomic_add32( offset, 1); \
}

({ \
    void* base = NULL; \
    base; \
})

pool,

#define CVM_COMMON_MAX_FPA_INFO_ENTRIES   5
 

#define cvm_common_mbuf_free (  ptr   )     _mbuf_free(__FILE__, __LINE__, ptr)
 

Macro to free an allocated FPA buffer after adjusting the start address correctly using the back field.

Parameters:
ptr - FPA address to be freed (cvmx_buf_ptr_t format)
This macro calculates the start address of the buffer correctly using the 'back' field before freeing the buffer. The pool information is also extracted from the 'ptr' parameter.

#define cvm_common_packet_free (  swp   )     _packet_free(__FILE__, __LINE__, swp)
 

Macro to free linked/gather buffer pointed to by the packet_ptr field of work queue entry.

Parameters:
swp - pointer to work queue entry
This macro frees linked or gather list pointed to by the packet_ptr field of work queue entry.

#define CVM_COMMON_WHICH_FPA_POOL (  ptr   ) 
 

Value:

({ \
    int pool = -1; \
    int i = 0; \
    for (i=0; i<CVMX_FPA_NUM_POOLS; i++) \
    { \
        cvm_common_fpa_info_t pool_info = cvm_common_fpa_info[i]; \
        int j=0; \
        for (j=0; j<pool_info.count; j++) \
        { \
      if (( (uint64_t)(CAST64(cvmx_phys_to_ptr(CAST64(ptr)))) >= pool_info.entry[j].start_addr) && ((uint64_t)(CAST64(cvmx_phys_to_ptr(CAST64(ptr)))) <= pool_info.entry[j].end_addr)) \
            { \
                pool = i; \
                break; \
            } \
        } \
        if (pool != -1) break; \
    } \
    pool;\
})
Macro to return FPA pool number for a memory address.

Parameters:
ptr - address pointer
This macro goes through the stored information to find out which pool the pointer 'ptr' belongs to

#define CVM_COMMON_WHICH_FPA_POOL_SEGMENT (  ptr,
pool   ) 
 

Value:

({ \
    int segment = -1; \
    cvm_common_fpa_info_t pool_info = cvm_common_fpa_info[pool]; \
    int j = 0; \
    for (j=0; j<pool_info.count; j++) \
    { \
      if (((uint64_t)(CAST64(cvmx_phys_to_ptr(CAST64(ptr)))) >= pool_info.entry[j].start_addr) && ((uint64_t)(CAST64(cvmx_phys_to_ptr(CAST64(ptr)))) <= pool_info.entry[j].end_addr)) \
        { \
            segment = j; \
            break; \
        } \
    } \
    segment;\
})

static int cvm_common_fpa_add_pool_info (  uint64_t  pool,
void *  buffer,
uint64_t  block_size,
uint64_t  num_blocks,
uint64_t  base
)  [inline, static]
 

Add FPA allocated memory information.

Parameters:
pool - FPA pool number
buffer - pointer to the start address of the allocated memory
block_size - size of each individual buffer in this pool (in bytes)
num_blocks - number of buffers allocated
base - address of extra memory allocated to keep track of FPA buffers
This function is used to add the FPA allocated information to future reference.

Note that this function should be called at the initializations time by the boot core.

static int cvm_common_fpa_display_all_pool_info (  void   )  [inline, static]
 

Display FPA allocated memory information.

This function displays various FPA allocated pools and their corresponding memory usage
